title: Ticket #174: condor_reconfig and friends should report security problems
description:
For many client tools (including condor_reconfig, and almost certainly on, off, and restart), they simply report "Sent "Reconfig" command to daemon at <128.105.185.14:52759>". They don't report if the daemon accepted it. Indeed, if the security layer rejects it with

01/30 14:00:22 PERMISSION DENIED to unauthenticated user from host 128.105.121.21 for command 60004 (DC_RECONFIG), access level WRITE: reason: WRITE authorization policy contains no matching ALLOW entry for this request; identifiers used for this host: 128.105.121.21,chopin.cs.wisc.edu

you'll have no idea. This confounds users all the time.

A core problem is that the tools "fire and forget", this will require revising the protocol, potentially switching to TCP, and other work.

Of course, failing for this reason deserves a non-0 exit code. (#172)
